page.title: 09Local History / Religion
page.content: There was a big battle in Ebberston village where a king was killed. He was king Arthur (but not from Camalot). There is a beck which flows through the battle field (as well as the main beck) called the bloody beck. This is because it was said to run red with blood. He was carried along kings lane, hence the name, and buried up above the village. Near where he is buried there is a tunnel, it is supposed to lead to church house. In all of the area the older people are quite religous but the youngsters are not. The main religion in Eberston is C of E, but there are some Roman Catholics.In Snainton there is a Church and a Chapel.Reverend Forster is the vicar of four Parishes.
